content.description: Pretty sweet bolted route with features that made me think of the Pit in Flagstaff. Cruiser->Crux->Cruiser.
content.protection: 8 bolts + anchor (shared with Six Foot Harvey)
content.location: 4th route on the wall from the left

content.description: Follow bolts up and right to bouldery crux and then cruise on great features to the anchors.
content.location: 3rd route from the left. First route after the large break in the wall to the right of Grieving and Project.

content.description: Variation of Grieving where you head right and up partway up Grieving. I did not see any bolts on the face, only a set of anchors up and right from the large cactus.
content.protection: anchors on top (TR? - not sure if you could traverse over from Grieving's anchors, but didn't see any bolts on the face)
content.location: Same start as Grieving, but trends right towards the top

content.description: As the name suggests, a pocketed face climb.
Obvious route as you look at the wall. Left-arching crack up near the top
content.protection: Small to large pro + sling belay/walk off
content.location: Rightmost route. Look for left-trending offwidth crack

content.description: Climb past bolts to ledge, move left, then continue up the face to the anchors which sit near the large cactus.
content.location: Leftmost route on the wall. It starts lower then the other routes and can be reached by downclimbing and traversing over or likely, by heading up the gully below the start.

content.description: West facing wall with some longer sport lines and an offwidth. Really great rock features make this wall worth a visit. Routes are a bit dirty but some of the holds are so big it doesn't even matter.
